DataElement.preferredName: Person Prior Treatment Regimen Complete Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response related to a person having completed a prior therapy regimen as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Prior Treatment Regimen Complete Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having completed a prior therapy regimen as an elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Prior Treatment Regimen Complete Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.:A means of finding a solution to a problem, or a means of finding agreement or harmony.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.
A means of finding a solution to a problem, or a means of finding agreement or harmony.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior intravesical therapy and/or adjuvant/neoadjuvant chemotherapy was it completed more than 6 months prior to diagnosis of advanced disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received at least one line of prior systemic chemotherapy and has experienced documented radiographic progression or intolerance on this therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery within 4 weeks of romidepsin administration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any major surgery, extensive radiotherapy, chemotherapy with delayed toxicity, biologic therapy, or immunotherapy within 28 days prior to enrollment and/or daily or weekly chemotherapy without the potential for delayed toxicity within 14 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last dose of prior chemotherapy, immunotherapy, or biologic therapy greater than or equal to 28 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed any prior chemotherapy, including that with delayed toxicity, targeted chemotherapy, extensive radiotherapy (unless palliative doses which must be discussed with Principal Investigator), any surgery, antiangiogenic therapy or interferon, biologic therapy, or immunotherapy greater than or equal to 28 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient completed any pri
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed any prior chemotherapy, targeted chemotherapy, radiotherapy (unless palliative doses which must be discussed with Principal Investigator), surgery, antiangiogenic therapy,  or interferon greater than or equal to 28 days before study entry or major surgery, extensive radiotherapy, chemotherapy with delayed toxicity, biologic therapy, or immunotherapy greater than or equal to 28 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last chemotherapy for incurable advanced or metastatic SCCA of the anal canal completed greater than or equal to 28 days (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to initiating treatment with nivolumab on this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior adjuvant/neoadjuvant chemotherapy was it completed more than 6 months prior to diagnosis of advanced disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has any prior therapy, radiotherapy, or major surgery been completed greater than or equal to 3 weeks (greater than 6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to enrollment on protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has treatment been completed at least 28 days prior to initiation of study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any major surgery, extensive radiotherapy (greater than 15 days of treatment), chemotherapy with delayed toxicity, biologic therapy, or immunotherapy within 21 days prior to first dose of study treatment and/or daily or weekly chemotherapy without the potential for delayed toxicity within 14 days prior to first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient at least 4 weeks away from any previous antineoplatic or investigational agent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last dose of prior chemotherapy or hormonal therapy at least 4 weeks or 5 half-lives, whichever is shorter, prior to starting protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 4 weeks elapsed since major surgery or radiation therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed last chemotherapy greater than or equal to 3 weeks OR radiotherapy greater than or equal to 2 weeks prior to receiving study drugs?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed chemotherapy greater than or equal to 3 weeks or radiotherapy greater than or equal to 2 weeks prior to receiving study drugs?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 12 months elapsed since platinum-based peri-operative treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has any prior therapy been completed at least 4 weeks prior to entry to the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last prior surgery 3 to 7 days prior to ibrutinib, depending on type of surgery and risk of bleeding?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 4 weeks elapsed since prior chemotherapy or radiation therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received radiation therapy within the last 4 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been off prior chemotherapy, molecular therapy with erlotinib, radiation therapy, or experimental biological or molecular therapy for at least 4 weeks prior to starting study medication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed chemotherapy, biological or radiotherapy greater than or equal to 3 weeks prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed antitumor therapy (chemotherapy, antibody therapy, molecular targeted therapy, retinoid therapy, hormonal therapy, or investigational agent) within 21 days of study day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed any chemotherapy, radiation therapy, or biologic therapy greater than or equal to 4 weeks or 5 half-lives (whichever is shorter) (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received any prior cytotoxic therapy, immunotherapy, radiotherapy, major surgery, antitumor vaccines or monoclonal antibodies in the 4 weeks or 5 half-lives, whichever is shorter, prior to C1D1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient enrolled on a clinical trial for the treatment of Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was any prior chemotherapy, targeted therapy and major surgery completed greater than or equal to 28 days before study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received systemic cytotoxic chemotherapy or immunotherapy for 3 weeks before initiation of of IPdR therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received systemic cytotoxic chemotherapy or immunotherapy for 3 weeks before initiation of IPdR therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received systemic cytotoxic chemotherapy, immunotherapy or other investigational agents for 3 weeks, or oral targeted agent for at least 4 half-lives, or radiotherapy to a non-brain site for 2 weeks before initiation of IPdR therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed antitumor therapy (chemotherapy, antibody therapy, molecular targeted therapy, retinoid therapy, hormonal therapy, or investigational agent) within 21 days of prior to C1D1 of AMG + KRd?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 37
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient complete their last treatment dose with chemotherapy or immunotherapy at least 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) before enrolling on study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 38
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has any prior therapy, radiotherapy, or major surgery been completed greater than or equal to 3 weeks (greater than 6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) or 5 half-lives of the agent, whichever is shorter, prior to enrollment on protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 41
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has prior systemic anti-cancer (cytotoxic, biologic or immunotherapeutic) therapy or radiation therapy, been completed LESS than 28 days prior to initiating study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 40
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has previous cytotoxic chemotherapy been completed at least 3 weeks prior to day 1 of treatment on the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 44
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior paclitaxel in the metastatic setting, was it completed more than 2 years prior to Radium-223 dichloride start?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 42
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed prior systemic cancer therapy at least 4 weeks prior to Cycle 1 Day 1 of treatment with the combination regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 43
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed any prior cytotoxic chemotherapy, oral tyrosine kinase inhibitor (TKI) or small molecule therapy, or immunotherapy within 2 weeks prior to the first dose of study medication or 5 half-lives, whichever is shorter?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 45
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of prior platinum-based systemic chemotherapy given as neoadjuvant, adjuvant, or consolidation therapy for early stage or loco-regionally advanced NSCLC, was it completed one year prior to initiation of treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 35
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed antitumor therapy (chemotherapy, antibody therapy, molecular targeted therapy, retinoid therapy, hormonal therapy, or investigational agent) at least 21 days prior to C1D1 of KRT-232 (AMG 232) + KRd?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 47
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received chemotherapy or definitive radiotherapy, was it completed  at least 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C), or palliative radiation completed at least 2 weeks prior to study enrollment or if known, within 5 half-lives of the prior agent (whichever is shorter) and within 1 week between prior therapy and study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 36
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has any prior systemic therapy (including checkpoint inhibitors), or major surgery been completed greater than or equal to 3 weeks (greater than 6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) or 5 half-lives of the agent, whichever is shorter, prior to enrollment on protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 49
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has prior anti-cancer treatment (cytotoxic chemotherapy or biologic, including immunotherapy) or radiation therapy been completed within 28 days prior to initiation of study treatment except for palliative radiation, for which 14 days applies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 48
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has any prior therapy been completed greater than or equal to 4 weeks or, if known, greater than or equal to 5 half-lives of the prior agent (whichever is shorter) prior to enrollment on protocol (minimum of 1 week between prior therapy and study enrollment)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was prior chemotherapy completed at least 4 weeks prior to the initiation of study treatment (at least 6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 7 days elapsed since the completion of therapy with a biologic agent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 50
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed prior radiotherapy greater than or equal to 6 months prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any of the following therapies during the screening and treatment phases (including retreatment for post-complete response relapse) of this trial: Antineoplastic systemic chemotherapy or biological therapy, Immunotherapy not specified in this protocol, Chemotherapy not specified in this protocol, or Investigational agents other than anetumab ravtansine and pembrolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 51
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed prior treatment for their cancer (chemotherapy or radiotherapy) greater than 2 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 46
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed induction chemotherapy less than 2 weeks or more than 8 weeks prior to study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 52
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to start of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 54
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was biologic therapy or chemotherapy completed greater than or equal to 5 half-lives or 3 weeks (whichever is shorter)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 53
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was prior chemotherapy completed greater than or equal to 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) or other investigational therapy to include hormonal, biological, or targeted agents; or at least 5 half-lives from hormonal, biological, or targeted agents, whichever is shorter at the time of study treatment initiation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 55
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was prior definitive radiation completed greater than or equal to 4 weeks prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 56
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was prior systemic therapy completed at least five half-lives or 2 weeks (whichever is shorter)?
